title: Fort Necessity National Battlefield: Distance Learning
body: Distance Learning      Fort Necessity National Battlefield's park rangers are available to video conference with your classroom via a bridge connection.  The programs are offered November through March and are FREE. To schedule a program call 724-329-8124 or contact the staff by emailing e-mail us.                  George Washington and the French and Indian War George Washington and the French and Indian War           Results   Showing results 1-1 of 1    Sort By:  Title Date         Fort Necessity National Battlefield George Washington and the French and Indian War    Talk with one of Fort Necessity National Battlefield’s park rangers about young George Washington and the French and Indian War.  Using George Washington’s writings students will see how his ambition, hard work and experiences helped him mature into the famous man we all know today.  The program will cover the beginning of the French and Indian War, the battle at Fort Necessity, Braddock’s defeat and the capture of  Fort Duquesne.  There will be time at the end for questions.    Type:Distance Learning Grade level:Fourth Grade-Twelfth Grade Subjects:Colonial History, French and Indian War, History, U.S. Presidents National/State Standards:US History: Era 2, Standard 1B.  Era 3, Standard 1A.  CCSS.ELA-Literacy.SL.4.1, SL.4.3;CCSS.ELA-Literacy.SL.5.1, 5.3;CCSS.ELA-Literacy.SL.6.1, 6.3;CCSS.ELA-Literacy.SL.7.1, 7.3;CCSS.ELA-Literacy.SL.8.1, 8.3
